title: Drawing, "Recto: A Fountain Group; verso: Designs for a Tureen and a Pitcher"
medium: Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and sepia on paper; verso: graphite, pen and dark ink
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Recto: A woman with a cloth is sitting upon a dolphin; beside it are two mermaids and two small boys. The round basin is sketched. Verso: a pitcher with a cover, a handle in the shape of a maze; the spout is formed by upper part of an eagle. At left, in vertical direction, the tureen with two lion feet, two masks with rings as handles, and a fruit basket as finial.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Recto: A Fountain Group; verso: Designs for a Tureen and a Pitcher".
Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and sepia on paper; verso: graphite, pen and dark ink. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7637.
